game

Interface EscapeState

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GameState

    public interface EscapeState
    The state of the game while escaping from the cavern. This interface provides access to a complete graph of the cavern which will allow you to compute your path out. Once you have determined how you want to escape, you can call moveTo(Node) to move to each node, and pickUpGold() to collect gold on your way out. An EscapeState provides all of the information necessary to escape from the cavern and collect gold on the way.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Node getCurrentNode()
      Returns the graph Node object corresponding to your current location in the graph.
      Node getExit()
      Returns the graph Node object associated with the exit to the cavern.
      int getTimeRemaining()
      Returns the time remaining to escape from the cavern.
      java.util.Collection<Node> getVertices()
      Returns a collection containing all of the nodes in the graph.
      void moveTo(Node n)
      Changes your current location to the specified node.
      void pickUpGold()
      Picks up any gold on the current tile.

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrentNode

        Node getCurrentNode()
        Returns the graph Node object corresponding to your current location in the graph.
        Returns:
        The graph Node object corresponding to your current location in the graph.

      • getExit

        Node getExit()
        Returns the graph Node object associated with the exit to the cavern. This is the node you need to move to in order to escape.
        Returns:
        The graph Node object associated with the exit to the cavern.

      • getVertices

        java.util.Collection<Node> getVertices()
        Returns a collection containing all of the nodes in the graph. These nodes are in no particular order, but every node is present.
        Returns:
        A collection containing all of the nodes in the graph.

      • moveTo

        void moveTo(Node n)
        Changes your current location to the specified node. You can only move to nodes directly connected to your current location by an edge.
        Parameters:
        n - the graph node you are moving to.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified node is not directly connected to your current location.

      • pickUpGold

        void pickUpGold()
        Picks up any gold on the current tile. You must first check that there is gold before picking it up.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if there is no gold at the current location, either because there never was any or because you picked it up already.

      • getTimeRemaining

        int getTimeRemaining()
        Returns the time remaining to escape from the cavern. This value will change with every call to moveTo(Node), and if it reaches before you escape, you have failed to escape.
        Returns:
        The time remaining to escape from the cavern.
